meanings.definition: A person who believes in the existence of a God or supreme being but denies revealed religion.
meanings.sent1: As a deist, she finds comfort in the idea of a higher power without following a specific religious doctrine.
meanings.sent2: The deist reflected on the wonders of the universe and the possibility of a divine creator.
meanings.sent3: The deist joked that their favorite 'holy book' was actually a science fiction novel.
meanings.sent4: In a world of uncertainty, the deist stood firm in their belief in a higher power guiding the universe.
meanings.sent5: The deist's faith in a supreme being was unwavering, even in times of hardship.

meanings.sent1: The deist philosophy emphasizes reason and natural law as guiding principles.
meanings.sent2: Her writing reflected a deist perspective, focusing on the existence of a distant, non-intervening deity.
meanings.sent3: The deist approach to problem-solving involved careful consideration of evidence and logical thinking.
meanings.sent4: In his artwork, he subtly incorporated deist themes, highlighting the beauty of the natural world.
meanings.sent5: The deist interpretation of the universe as a well-ordered system resonated with many thinkers of the Enlightenment.
